text: <a href="../2-Chronicles-14-1/" title="2 Chronicles 14:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-2/" title="2 Chronicles 14:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And Asa did *that which was* good and right in the eyes of the LORD his God:

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-3/" title="2 Chronicles 14:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 For he took away the altars of the strange *gods*, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves:

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-4/" title="2 Chronicles 14:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And commanded Judah to seek the LORD God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-5/" title="2 Chronicles 14:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-6/" title="2 Chronicles 14:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the LORD had given him rest.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-7/" title="2 Chronicles 14:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about *them* walls, and towers, gates, and bars, *while* the land *is* yet before us; because we have sought the LORD our God, we have sought *him*, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-8/" title="2 Chronicles 14:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And Asa had an army *of men* that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these *were* mighty men of valour.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-9/" title="2 Chronicles 14:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-10/" title="2 Chronicles 14:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-11/" title="2 Chronicles 14:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And Asa cried unto the LORD his God, and said, LORD, *it is* nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O LORD our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O LORD, thou *art* our God; let not man prevail against thee.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-12/" title="2 Chronicles 14:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 So the LORD smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-13/" title="2 Chronicles 14:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And Asa and the people that *were* with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the LORD, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-14/" title="2 Chronicles 14:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the LORD came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-15/" title="2 Chronicles 14:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
